channel.title: Window's Media Player and Verizon Cell Phone
channel.description:
I'm attempting to get window's media player to send media files to my Verizon EnV phone. The player itself sends them, but it doesn't recognize certain types of audio files (mpeg 4, aac, etc). How can I fix this?
Thanks in advance
Deathpal

item.title: Window's Media Player and Verizon Cell Phone
item.dc:creator: @ninja_nub ninja nub
item.description:
@ninja_nub wrote:

I X Wolf X I:

itunes.com – apple.com FOLLOW THIS LINK download iTunes and use it to convert the files to .mp3 .mp4 .m4a .wmv .wav ETC.

Learn how to use [url=http://] tags.

And just get a free converter. Remember Google it.

Read full topic
item.source: Window's Media Player and Verizon Cell Phone

item.title: Window's Media Player and Verizon Cell Phone
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

[quote=“Death_Pal, post:1, topic:157217”]I’m attempting to get window’s media player to send media files to my Verizon EnV phone. The player itself sends them, but it doesn’t recognize certain types of audio files (mpeg 4, aac, etc). How can I fix this?

Thanks in advance

Deathpal[/quote]

Get a program called “Switch” it’s a really good audio converter that I use all the time.

item.title: Window's Media Player and Verizon Cell Phone
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

iTunes allows you to convert between .mp3, .m4a, .wmv, .wav files. My chocolate also only plays .mp3… and only some mp3s. It blows.

Read full topic
